ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a weapon. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.6_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.7_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a weapon who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.8.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.10_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.11_0: The tenth training rule is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.12_0: The sixth sub-chapter on slurping is finished.
